results.title: ‘The Power of the Dog,’ ‘Dune,’ ‘Belfast’ and ‘West Side Story’ lead the nominations.
results.abstract: Netflix has two films in the running for a best picture Oscar: “The Power of the Dog,” with 12 nominations, and “Don’t Look Up,” with four.
results.byline: By Brooks Barnes and Nicole Sperling

multimedia.caption: Ariana DeBose in “West Side Story,” and Benedict Cumberbatch in “The Power of the Dog.” Both movies were nominated for best picture and DeBose was nominated for best supporting actress.

results.title: My Favorite Wholesome, Humiliating Stunt, by the Stars of ‘Jackass’
results.abstract: With a new film in the franchise about to hit theaters, we asked them about the torments they remember most fondly.

results.title: ‘Jackass Forever’ Review: A Visit From the Goon Squad
results.abstract: Sharp cinematography and enviable camaraderie continue to hoist Johnny Knoxville and friends above their many imitators in this deceptively kindhearted sequel.

results.abstract: In this month’s picks, evil seizes a bathroom, cloaked cultists invade a small town and demons run amok just about everywhere else.

results.title: ‘Lingui, the Sacred Bonds’ Review: Love, Ferocious and Limitless
results.abstract: In this electric liberation story from Chad, a mother struggles to protect her daughter’s future and finds both herself and a world of possibility.

results.title: Can Jennifer Lopez Save the Rom-Com?
results.abstract: After navigating the treacherous waters of celebrity, the superstar is betting on “Marry Me,” a movie that sounds a lot like her personal life.

multimedia.caption: The new film is in some ways about what it’s like to exist in Jennifer Lopez’s spotlight, what she calls “a very specific life.”

results.title: Ariana DeBose on Her First Oscar Nomination: ‘This Role Embodies Every Facet of Me’
results.abstract: The 31-year-old actress was nominated for her turn as Anita in “West Side Story” — a part she fought to ensure reflected her Afro-Latina identity.

results.title: ‘Alice’s Wonderland Bakery’: Recipes for Real Life, if Not Real Kitchens
results.abstract: A new Disney show teaches children useful lessons in the guise of a cooking show. The recipes are less practical (unless you stock dancing dodo eggs).

multimedia.caption: In “Alice’s Wonderland Bakery,” the great-granddaughter of Alice from “Alice in Wonderland” teaches young viewers valuable lessons with the help of a magical talking cookbook.

results.title: John Williams, Hollywood’s Maestro, Looks Beyond the Movies
results.abstract: The composer of “Star Wars” and “Jaws,” who turned 90 this week, says he will soon step away from film. But he has no intention of slowing down.

results.title: 2022 Oscars Nominations: Snubs and Surprises for Lady Gaga and Jared Leto
results.abstract: Kristen Stewart was a surprise best actress nominee after being shut out of other precursor awards. And the academy likes not one but two acting couples.

results.title: Troy Kotsur Makes History as the First Deaf Actor to Get a Nomination
results.abstract: The performer has been a particular favorite this awards season. He stars in “CODA” as the father of a hearing daughter who dreams of being a singer.

‘Fight Club’ Ending Is Restored in China After Censorship Outcry
results.abstract: Last month, viewers noticed that the ending of the 1999 film had been replaced with a pro-government message. Now the ending is back, and the message is gone.

results.title: The Power of a Good Cry
results.abstract: Tears are central to great acting. A lifetime of weeping at the movies has taught me how much letting it all go in real life can matter, too.

results.title: Martine Colette, Who Rescued Exotic Animals, Is Dead at 79
results.abstract: Her wildlife sanctuary just outside Los Angeles was among the first of its kind and was supported by Hollywood luminaries.

multimedia.caption: Martine Colette at the Wildlife Waystation, the animal sanctuary near Los Angeles that she founded in 1976. At 160 acres, it was larger than most municipal zoos.
multimedia.copyright: David Bohrer/Los Angeles Times via Getty Images

results.title: From Chad, a Filmmaker and a Star Committed to Telling Stories of Home
results.abstract: In “Lingui, the Sacred Bonds,” the director Mahamat-Saleh Haroun works again with Achouackh Abakar Souleymane, this time on a wrenching drama about abortion.

multimedia.caption: Mahamat-Saleh Haroun said he wanted to tell the story of an unwanted pregnancy “from a Chadian point of view in a human way.”
Mahamat-Saleh Haroun said he wanted to tell the story of an unwanted pregnancy “from a Chadian point of view in a human way.”

results.title: Renate Reinsve Steps, Reluctantly, Into the Spotlight
results.abstract: The Norwegian actress was ready to quit the business before she was cast as the lead in “The Worst Person in the World.” Now she’s navigating newfound fame.
